subject: Re: [junit] test to see if the output is a string or an	interger
msgSnippet: ... Or, if you re into doing things in a brute force manner, the Character class has an isLetter(char c) static method.  If you go this way, I d suggest a
messageBody:
Craig Pardey wrote:

>.. or even better
>
>public void testBlah()
>{
> String stringUnderTest = "???";
>
> try {
> Integer.parseInt(stringUnderTest);
> fail("stringUnderTest '"+stringUnderTest+"' was numeric");
> }
> catch(NumberFormatException nfe) {
> // stringUnderTest isn't an int, therefore we passed
> }
>}
>
>

Or, if you're into doing things in a brute force manner, the Character
class has an isLetter(char c) static method. If you go this way, I'd
suggest a convenience method taking a String that walks all the
characters while performing the isLetter() test. I'm thinking that
method might possibly find a home in production code.

Mike
